Class MyDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Genetic_Rule_Learning.M5Rules.MyDataset

  • public class MyDataset
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to implement the dataset

      • MyDataset

        public MyDataset(java.lang.String name,
                 java.util.Vector attInfo,
                 int capacity)
        Creates an empty set of itemsets. Uses the given attribute information. Sets the capacity of the set of itemsets to 0 if its negative. Given attribute information must not be changed after this constructor has been used.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the relation
        attInfo - the attribute information
        capacity - the capacity of the set

                 int first,
                 int toCopy)
        Creates a new set of itemsets by copying a subset of another set.
        Parameters:
        source - the set of itemsets from which a subset is to be created
        first - the index of the first itemset to be copied
        toCopy - the number of itemsets to be copied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if first and toCopy are out of range

        public double[] attributeToDoubleArray(int index)

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the attribute.
        Returns:

      • trainCV

        public MyDataset trainCV(int numFolds,
                         int numFold)
        Creates the training set for one fold of a cross-validation on the dataset.
        Parameters:
        numFolds - the number of folds in the cross-validation. Must be greater than 1.
        numFold - 0 for the first fold, 1 for the second, ...
        Returns:
        the training set as a set of weighted itemsets
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of folds is less than 2 or greater than the number of itemsets.

      • testCV

        public MyDataset testCV(int numFolds,
                        int numFold)
        Creates the test set for one fold of a cross-validation on the dataset.
        Parameters:
        numFolds - the number of folds in the cross-validation. Must be greater than 1.
        numFold - 0 for the first fold, 1 for the second, ...
        Returns:
        the test set as a set of weighted itemsets
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of folds is less than 2 or greater than the number of itemsets.

      • filter

        public void filter(Mask mask,
                   int A,
                   double V,
                   int operator)
        It filters the instances covered by a simple rule from this dataset; i.e., it deactivates the instances not covered by that rule.
        Parameters:
        mask - Mask the mask with the active entries of the dataset
        A - int attribute's id
        V - double attribute's value
        operator - int rule operator. It could be: Rule.EQUAL(for discret attributes), Rule.GREATER (>) or Rule.LOWER(<=)

      • filter

        public void filter(Mask mask,
                   SimpleRule sr)
        It filters the instances covered by a simple rule from this dataset; i.e., it deactivates the instances not covered by that rule.
        Parameters:
        mask - Mask the mask with the actives entries of the dataset
        sr - SimpleRule the rule

        public void filter(Mask mask,
                   Rule rule)

        Parameters:

        rule - Rule the rule

      • filter

        public void filter(Mask mask,
                   Ruleset rules,
                   int ignore)
        It filters the instances covered by a set of rule from this dataset; i.e., it deactivates the instances not covered by that ruleset.
        Parameters:
        mask - Mask the mask with the active entries of the dataset
        rules - Ruleset the ruleset
        ignore - int the algorithm ignores the i-th rule of the ruleset

      • substract

        public void substract(Mask mask,
                      Ruleset rules)
        It substracts the instances covered by a set of rule from this dataset; i.e., it deactivates the instances covered by that ruleset.
        Parameters:
        mask - Mask the mask with the active entries of the dataset
        rules - Ruleset the set of rules

      • substract

        public void substract(Mask mask,
                      Ruleset rules,
                      int ignore)
        It substracts the instances covered by a set of rules from this dataset; i.e., it deactivates the instances covered by that ruleset. This method allows to ignore a rule of the set.
        Parameters:
        mask - Mask the mask with the active entries of the dataset
        rules - Ruleset the set of rules
        ignore - int number of the rule to ignore

      • ruleDeviation

        public final double ruleDeviation(Rule r)
        Computes the deviation of a rule from the predicted class values. RMS=SQRT(Sum((Yi-yi)^2)/Nr) Yi=actual class value of the itemset i yi=predicted class value for the itemset i Nr=covered instances
        Parameters:
        r - the rule
        Returns:
        the deviation of a rule from the predicted class values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the class is not numeric

      • ruleMeanAbsoluteError

        public final double ruleMeanAbsoluteError(Rule r)
        Computes the mean absolute error of a rule for the predicted class values. MAE/Cover=Sum(|Yi-yi|)/2Nr Yi=actual class value of the itemset i yi=predicted class value for the itemset i Nr=covered instances
        Parameters:
        r - the rule
        Returns:
        the mean absolute error of a rule for the predicted class values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the class is not numeric

      • ruleCorrelation

        public final double ruleCorrelation(Rule r)
        Computes the third heuristic exposed in [Holmes99]. _ _ CC*Cover=Nr*Sum((Yi-Y)(yi-y))/(Nr*std(Y)*std(y)) Yi=actual class value of the itemset i yi=predicted class value for the itemset i Nr=covered instances (obvied->Nr/Nr) _ _ Y,y = means of its respective sets of values std(Y),std(y) = standard deviation of its respective sets of values
        Parameters:
        r - the rule
        Returns:
        the heuristic value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the class is not numeric

      • classify

        public java.lang.String[] classify(Mask actives,
                                   Ruleset[] rulesets,
                                   int length)
        Classifies the entries' classes according to several sets of rules.
        Parameters:
        actives - Mask active entries of the dataset
        rulesets - Ruleset[] the rulesets
        length - int the number of rulesets
        Returns:
        a vector of the length of this dataset with the class name for each entry.

      • split

        public MyDataset[] split(Rule r)
        It split phisically the itemsets into two subdatasets, according to the coverage of a rule.
        Parameters:
        r - the rule
        Returns:
        two dataset, the first one (0) with the exemples covered by the rule, the second one (1) with the rest of them (the uncoverd exemples).
